thread.title: Derrick Henry Provides Emotional Farewell to Titans Fans ‚Äì ‚ÄúI Hope I Was an Inspiration to All the Young Kids‚Äù
thread.title_full: Derrick Henry Provides Emotional Farewell to Titans Fans ‚Äì ‚ÄúI Hope I Was an Inspiration to All the Young Kids‚Äù

author: Lorenzo Reyna
title: Derrick Henry Provides Emotional Farewell to Titans Fans ‚Äì ‚ÄúI Hope I Was an Inspiration to All the Young Kids‚Äù
text:
The
Tennessee Titans became a part of two endings on Sunday in Week 18.
The first one involved ending the Jacksonville Jaguars‚Äô pursuit of the AFC South title and playoff berth, knocking off their AFC South rivals 28-20. But the second ending they became a part of? The Derrick Henry era.
Derrick Henry Delivers Emotional Postgame Speech at Nissan Stadium
Sunday‚Äôs win likely marked the final game for star running back Derrick Henry in a Titans uniform.
Henry, the powerful locomotive who won two league rushing titles and surpassed 2,000 yards back in 2020, is an unrestricted free agent for the 2024 offseason. And he looked like his old self against his longtime rivals by racking up 153 yards and a touchdown.
The 30-year-old gave the Titans fan base one last dominating rushing output for the 2023 season. But then he took the microphone to give his fans one more lasting memory ‚Äî a goodbye.
‚ÄúTitan fans, I want to say thank you for the greatest eight years of my life,‚Äù Henry began. ‚ÄúThe ups and the downs, y‚Äôall have been there through everything from the adversity and watching me grind as a person and a player. You always supported me. I love y‚Äôall. I love seeing the 22s in the stadium.‚Äù
Henry hoped he left a lasting impact on Nashville, particularly the youth.
‚ÄúI hope I was an inspiration to all the young kids and everybody in the community. I respect y‚Äôall so much,‚Äù Henry said.
He ended his speech with two words: ‚ÄúTitans up.‚Äù Then, he jogged off the field and was showered with ‚ÄúHenry!‚Äù chants as he took what is likely his final trip through the Nissan Stadium tunnel.
"
[@Titans]fans‚Ä¶ Thank you for the greatest 8 years of my life." üëëüíô [@KingHenry_2] [pic.twitter.com/3CpEHq4PiC]
‚Äî NFL (@NFL)
[January 7, 2024]
DeAndre Hopkins Offers Reaction to Henry‚Äôs Speech and Titans Career
Again, it‚Äôs likely the veteran running back and the Titans are trekking toward a mutual separation.
For De‚ÄôAndre Hopkins, he won‚Äôt get the chance to share the same Titans locker room with ‚ÄúKing Henry‚Äù in 2024. The longtime rival of Tennessee from his Houston Texans days joined Henry and the Titans immediately before the season as a free agent.
Still, the four-time Pro Bowl wide receiver told reporters he was honored to be impacted by the presence of Henry.
‚ÄúDerrick is going to get that standing ovation no matter what kind of game he had. To me, it‚Äôs a dream come true to play with a guy who‚Äôs going to be in the NFL Hall of Fame and plays the way he plays,‚Äù Hopkins told reporters in the locker room. ‚ÄúEspecially for 8-9 years. I don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs going to stop anytime soon.‚Äù
Hopkins added he knew Henry before they became NFL teammates as they‚Äôve worked out before. He added Henry didn‚Äôt think he‚Äôd come over to the Titans.
Still, the two men paired together. For Hopkins, the presence of Henry fulfills one of his hopes for his own career.

‚ÄúI always hoped to play with a great running back,‚Äù Hopkins said. ‚ÄúEspecially this late in my career. I can handle the load, but it definitely helps to have a running back to make things easier on the outside.‚Äù
DeAndre Hopkins on Derrick Henry. Says it was a dream come true playing with a future HOF running back.
[#Titans] [pic.twitter.com/Rco6HSnKPn]
‚Äî AtoZ Sports Nashville (@AtoZSports)
[January 7, 2024]
Hopkins ended up being a part of Henry‚Äôs final run as a Titan. And for Henry, he gave closure to a dominating run from 2016 to now.
